intro: Pancheria elliptica, commonly known as the elliptic pancheria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its elongated, elliptical leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or swampy areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
